page.title: 11INDUSTRY in CHAPMORE END
page.content: Horseman's Joinery was established in 1972 on land which was formerly brick works utilizing the local clay. They make products from wood especially furniture and window frames which are sold to building firms. Contracts for work are received from many firms in London but more of their products are sold in shops. Occasionally they take orders and specially design and build the equipment needed. Most of the wood used is imported from Scandinavia and the Far East and comes to the joinery via the docks by lorry. Roughly 45 people are employed mostly local, living within 12 miles of Chapmore End. In nearby Tonwell is another small joinery which concentrates on producing fencing and palettes. They employ six people. Lorries stacked with these palettes are a common sight.
